result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward A. Graves was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Edward A. Graves is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Edward A. Graves was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Edward A. Graves was found guilty of Resisting an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with the victim of this crime or his ex-wife.  While on probation, DOC shall promptly notify the Court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

Defendant Edward A. Graves appeared with Attorney William Paul Michel.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Tracey Lynn Braun appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  Witnesses sequestered.    ST called witness KPD Det Daniel Wienke; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Michel. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial.  DE filed substitution of Br 8;  tab pulled for Br 3.   Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 09:20 am.  Jury selection scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.
